comment.author: 27109792@N00
comment._content: I think this is Mrs James Rolph - Mayor of San Francisco (1912-1931) and Governor of California (1931-34) capitolmuseum.ca.gov/firstladies.aspx?content2=1712

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Yes, that must be Annie Marshall Reid Rolph, the mayor's wife, probably voting for the first time. In a referendum, California's voters approved women's suffrage in 1911. This photo probably dates from 1912. The San Francisco public library has this photo of a considerably older Annie Rolph with her husband "Sunny Jim", at the polls once again, in 1930 when he was running for Governor.

comment.author: 27109792@N00
comment._content: I think you've made a pretty good assessment of this, excellent work.

comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content:
Thanks. 

The cylinder does look like it might be the ballot box. It's numbered, and there's a key hanging from the end of it.
